numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I thank all the students who responded.
2. We received some catchy headlines.
3. Tatum is a student of Andover High School in Massachusetts.
4. Tatum wrote the headline "Are Young Men Ghosting Their Parents?".
5. Caroline is a student of Academy of Saint Elizabeth in Morristown, New Jersey.
6. Caroline wrote the headline "Parents and Children: How Connected Are They Really?".
7. Alea is a student from California.
8. Alea wrote the headline "Family Connections in the Digital Age".
9. Miles is a student of California Polytechnic State University in San Luis Obispo.
10. Miles wrote the headline "Staying in Touch: Why Do Young Women Seem to Do It More Frequently?".
11. Hailey is a student of California Polytechnic State University in San Luis Obispo.
12. Hailey wrote the headline "Staying Connected: Young Women Lead in Family Communication".
13. Aaron is a student of California Polytechnic State University in San Luis Obispo.
14. Aaron wrote the headline "Screen Age: How Electronics Have Impacted Parental Communication".
15. Please return on Friday.
16. On Friday, we will reveal a free link to the article.
17. The article included this graph.
18. On Friday, we will reveal a summary of the article.
19. On Friday, we will reveal additional questions.
20. On Friday, we will give shout outs for some of the best headlines for the graph.
21. On Friday, we will reveal Stat Nuggets.
22. Stat Nuggets are definitions of words.
23. These words relate to the graphs.
24. On Friday, we will reveal where you can find these words in the graphs.
25. This graph is the second to last graph of the school year.
26. Please return on Friday.
27. On Friday, we will release the last graph.
28. The topic of the last graph is hotter summers.
29. Sharon Hessney signs off.
30. Sharon Hessney is from Boston.
31. Sharon Hessney used to write letters home when Sharon Hessney was in college.
32. Sharon Hessney paid by the minute to call on Sunday at 11 am.
33. Erica Heinzman signs off.
34. Erica Heinzman is from San Diego.
35. Erica Heinzman is thankful.
36. The days of long distance charges are in the past.
37. Sometimes it is best said on a handwritten card.
38. You can treasure a handwritten card.
